channel.title: [TUT]Making a Jar
channel.description:
after a few google searches i finally figured out how to make a Executable jar file thingy.the other tuts how to make a Jar file didn't work for me so i tought i would post this.
First open up Notepad and put this in it and save it as Client.mft also dont forget to change "Client" in what your main class is. (dont forget to add the extra space below Main-Class: Client [code]Main-Class: Client
[/code]
ok now open up cmd and and type in [code]cd c:\client[/code] (i'm assuming you have your client or whatever you want to make into a jar file is in your c:\ directory)
now type in in your cmd [code]jar cmf Client.mft Client.jar *.class[/code] and you should now have a Jar file named :Client
I tested this with a simple HelloWorld GUI so i dont know if this works with Clients also.
this is my first tut so i might have made some mistakes in my tut so post anything you dont understand.

item.description:
@Scar wrote:

[quote=“wrolyat, post:21, topic:18601”]I made a client.mf file and did

jar cvf test.jar client.class

But it says I am missing the manifest file. I don’t know much about java, but how could I fix this error?[/quote]

its CMF instead of CVF…maybe thats the problem?
This is how it should be :

jar cmf test.jar client.class

item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

Actually, theres another thing he has to do . . .[quote=“wrolyat, post:27, topic:18601”]<applet name="app" width="765" height="503" archive="http://www.freewebs.com/somesitehere/client377.jar" code="client">[/quote]

Should be <applet name="app" codebase="http://www.freewebs.com/somesitehere/" archive="client377.jar" code="client.class">

he forgot codebase

item.title: [TUT]Making a Jar
item.dc:creator: @1337h4x 1337h4x
item.description:
@1337h4x wrote:

Dude. Make a manifest file. Init put:

Manifest-Version: 1.0 Created-By: 1.6.0 (Sun Microsystems Inc.) Main-Class: client.class

.> retard.

Read full topic

<applet name="app" width="765" height="503" archive="http://www.freewebs.com/somesitehere/client377.jar" code="client">

Read full topic

item.title: [TUT]Making a Jar
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

What the hell lol? First: are you trying to run the client from a website, or off the command line or out of a jar? Because if your running it as an applet, you need to include init().

If your running it as a jar, put all the class files in one folder, and in that folder put a folder named META-INF with MANIFEST.MF in it like I said. And then do jar -cmf something.jar META-INF *.class and well, wouldn’t you know it, theres the jar file!

Read full topic

item.title: [TUT]Making a Jar
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

You can only have one manifest per jar. Why the hell would you try to add a second?

item.description:
@wrolyat wrote:

Alright, I’m making a client into a .jar file to be run on my site. I already have a META-INF folder with MANIFEST.MF and MANIFESTI.MF in it. I just named my manifest file to MANIFEST1.MF. I still get the error… I believe it’s because of the multiple manifests in the folder…

Read full topic

item.title: [TUT]Making a Jar
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

Put this in a file and save it as MANIFEST.MF in a folder named META-INF

Manifest-Version: 1.0
Created-By: 1.6.0 (Sun Microsystems Inc.)
Main-Class: WhatEverYourMainClassIs

And do jar -cfm WhatEver.jar META-INF *.class

Read full topic
